# Developer Portfolio and Blog

This is a personal website showcasing my portfolio as a software developer, along with a blog where I write about technology, coding tips, tutorials, and industry insights. This project is based on the project [Gatsby Starter Blog](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog) and has been customized to also be used as a portfolio to showcase my skills.

## Features

- **Responsive Design**: Works seamlessly across all devices, from mobile to desktop.
- **Blog**: A section dedicated to writing technical articles and tutorials on various development topics.
- **Markdown Support**: Write blog posts and documentation in markdown format.

## Getting Started

To get started with this project, follow these instructions:

### Prerequisites

Make sure you have the following installed on your local development machine:

- [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/) (v18+)
- [Gatsby CLI](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/gatsby-cli/)


## Installation & Set Up

1. Install dependencies

   ```sh
   npm install
   ```

2. Start the development server

   ```sh
   gatsby develop
   ```

## ðŸš€ Building and Running for Production

1. Generate a full static production build

   ```sh
   gatsby build
   ```

1. Preview the site as it will appear once deployed

   ```sh
   gatsby serve
   ```

## Deployment
To deploy the website, you can use any static hosting provider like Netlify, Vercel, or GitHub Pages.

For deploying to GitHub Pages:

1. Run the following command to build the static files:

```
gatsby build
```

2. Deploy the public directory to your gh-pages branch:

```
npm run deploy
```
